programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Frank contends with public outcry to defund the NYPD School Safety Division, after a physical altercation between a school officer and a student goes viral; Danny and Baez help a father track down his missing ex-wife and daughter.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Frank, Baker, Garrett and Gormley experience guilt when an officer they briefly worked with is shot after Frank reassigned her for not meshing with their team; Anthony is offered a promotion that strains his relationship with Erin.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Frank is blindsided when Mayor Chase bypasses him with a request for Jamie to head his security detail; Danny and Baez investigate the murder of a wealthy college student; Anthony fears money woes are leading his sibling down the wrong path.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: A local celebrity asks Frank to make an exception to the NYPD age limit; an encounter with an old rival leads Erin to look into an alleged wrongful conviction; Jamie is torn over whether to report a sergeant; Danny and Baez look for an abducted kid.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Erin is stalked by a man who was recently released from prison; Jamie works to save his badge when he is caught driving under the influence after he is unknowingly given drugs at a party; Frank navigates multiple family issues.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: Will and Sonny help move a low-budget traveling rodeo.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: Will and Sonny deliver pipe casings to an Idaho wildcat oil well driller, and he hires them to be in charge of oil transportation before the well comes in.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: Will, Sonny and a fellow trucker run afoul of a police officer and his speed trap, and they get involved in a series of football games that turn out with higher stakes than expected.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: Will and Sonny haul auctioned farm equipment for the Hoots, an old-world farming colony, and get involved in a dispute between them and the surrounding farmers.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: Will talks Sonny into hauling timber with Will's Vietnam War buddy in Hood River, Oregon.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: One of Nick's favorite actors is shooting a western. After some strange accidents, he hires Nick and Sylvie to go on the set undercover and try to determine what is going on. Spider joins them on the job.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: NCIS agents McGee and Torres head to New Orleans to partner with Pride and his team in the search for the missing homeland security theoretical terror playbook.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Painful memories come flooding back when a gruesome copycat murder leads to the reopening of a case for Wade.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride's longtime friend, state and military attorney Rita Devereaux, asks NCIS to investigate the disappearance of a JAG lawyer who specializes in classified cases and volunteers at a private military academy.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A highly skilled special operations Marine assaults six men in a bar, sending the NCIS team on a city-wide manhunt.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A shocking murder pulls rookie officer Dante Torres into his own neighborhood; as Voight and Atwater help him navigate the case and manage tricky personal dynamics with wary neighbors, Torres realizes his life may be forever changed.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Upton's dogged pursuit of a missing teenage girl leads the team into a dark web of human trafficking; chief O'Neal becomes involved with the unit's investigation when it becomes evident his son, Sean, has a connection to the missing girl.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Atwater's reactions during a tense arrest are called into question; the team must dig in to uncover key evidence that could aid in the ongoing investigation and clear Atwater's name.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: When actionable evidence finally surfaces against Sean O'Neal, Upton and the team work relentlessly to build a case in secret; they discover Sean is more elusive and dangerous than anticipated.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: To distract Intelligence from the investigation into his son, Chief O'Neal forces the team to handle a "dead fish" case; when that dead fish turns into a complicated heater case, Burgess is thrown back into difficult memories from her past.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: After a shocking discovery, the team begins closing in on Sean O'Neal with every shred of evidence they can find; determined to keep his son out of prison, Chief O'Neal hires a lawyer.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A series of brutal home invasion robberies finds the team paired with Detective Borkowski, an old friend of Ruzek's, to work the case; things get complicated for Torres when it becomes clear Borkowski has a vastly different policing style.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A shocking ambush at a funeral leads the team into a heated investigation to find the shooters; much to Atwater's surprise, he must rely on someone from his past to help in the investigation, dredging up old memories and revealing new truths.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Sean O'Neal surprises Upton with a call from prison, revealing sensitive information; while Upton grapples with how to keep O'Neal at a distance, the team quickly mobilizes to stop a crime in progress before it's too late.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Voight and the team help ASA Nina Chapman pursue a drug runner who dodged prison years ago after Chapman's informant mysteriously disappeared; the investigation takes a turn when Voight uncovers a damaging secret from Chapman's past.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: After a brutal shooting, Burgess and Ruzek find themselves trapped aboard the busy "L" subway; as they piece together scant evidence, the team is drawn into a dark family drama; Burgess' proximity to the shooting triggers harsh memories.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: When a family is poisoned in their home, the team discovers a connection to the Becks; Ruzek goes undercover to work for their business, and as he gets closer to Samantha, chilling information about her father, Richard, comes to light.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Voight takes the stand in a high-stakes murder trial against notorious drug kingpin Arturo Morales; when it becomes clear that Morales and his henchmen have compromised a juror, Voight and the team work furiously to ensure justice prevails.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: As the team investigates a convenience store robbery, the evidence leads them to an unusual pair of suspects, revealing a dark personal drama and another potential victim; Burgess slowly makes strides tackling her past trauma.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: An Englishman is being blackmailed, possibly by his vengeful former partner in crime. He and his wife hire Nick to get to the bottom of things.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A couple filing for divorce hires Nick and Sylvie separately. The husband hires Sylvie to prove his wife's infidelity, while the wife hires Nick to prove her husband's infidelity.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A woman who's cheating on her husband with a young lover is being blackmailed. She hires Nick to help her, but it might be too late to prevent a tragedy.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: When Nick's old P.I. colleague is found dead, he gets the dead colleague's strange case that involves a wealthy property developer.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A businessman hires Nick to find his missing wife. The man's colleagues may know something about her disappearance.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: An eyewitness falls for Nick when he stops an armed robbery at a store. She decides to help him identify the robber she saw fleeing from the store. There's just one problem - she might be seeing things.

programme.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
programme.desc: Phil tries to build a tower strong enough to not fall apart when shaken in a massive earthquake; balancing on wood, getting sucked into sand, cookie towers and a table made of people.

programme.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
programme.desc: Phil tries to bend the power of sound by making the loudest sound he can. Plus: make cornstarch mud dance.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Today we are hopping down to South America to check out some of the coolest creatures on Earth. Animals featured include the parrot, the sea lion, the tapir, the iguana, and more!

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Did you know a beavers teeth never stop growing and that it can use them to build dams big enough to see from outer space? A flock of Canada geese can migrate 1500 miles in a single day. Plus, the Bison can move 40 mph!

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau looks at new ways of cultivating fresh, nutritious food. He visits a farm in Los Angeles where they grow food on a parking lot, just to show that fresh food can be grown in an urban environment. We also look into what distinguishes fruits from vegetables. The results can be surprising. And then we look at the amount of food that is wasted world wide.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: This week we see how science helps us prepare for natural disasters. Philippe heads to the University of Miami to see their incredible SUSTAIN lab that can simulate a category 5 hurricane. Then it's off to the mountains of Alberta to learn about avalanche safety. From there's we head to South Carolina to follow researchers that study floods.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett meets a woman who helps him reopen the last cold case his father investigated before dying.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: On Halloween, the team hunts a serial killer who mimics murders from a cult slasher film; Jerry is abducted by counterfeiters.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett experiences what would have happened to the team had they taken a different path when he is kidnapped by Wo Fat.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Sons become the prime suspects in the murder of their parents; Aunt Deb shocks McGarrett when she returns to the island with her new fiance.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: An old-school private detective helps the Five-0 solve the murder of a young woman who secretly worked as an escort.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When a tourist unknowingly transporting a stolen Van Gogh is murdered, Kono and Chin go under cover into the world of black market art; McGarrett asks chef Masaharu Morimoto to train Kamekona for a shrimp cook-off.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When a neurosurgeon is murdered right before a procedure, the stunning truth about a decades-old disappearance of four school boys is revealed; McGarrett's car is stolen.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A patient with a contagious and deadly strain of bird flu is kidnapped -- and the people responsible plan to weaponize the virus.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Kono must fight for her life after discovering a notorious criminal's identity; Adam's ties to his formerly corrupt family business leaves Kono feeling concerned.

programme.title: 60 Days In
programme.desc: Newly elected sheriff Mark Lamb sends six volunteers into the Pinal County Detention Center on a mission to uncover valuable Intel about the gangs, drugs and operational issues.

programme.title: 60 Days In
programme.desc: With three participants in the jail and two more on their way in, Sheriff Lamb's mission-based program is off to the races.

programme.title: 60 Days In
programme.desc: With all seven participants embedded in the facility, some struggle to maintain their distance from one another.

programme.title: 60 Days In
programme.desc: As the participants begin to focus on their missions, some find early success while others are met with immediate interference; Sheriff Lamb is forced to make a tough decision.

programme.title: Kids Behind Bars: Life or Parole
programme.desc: On January 31, 2011, 14-year-old Aaron shot his neighbor, 14-year-old Alana, in her home in Harlem, Georgia. Aaron was sentenced to life without parole at 15.

programme.title: Kids Behind Bars: Life or Parole
programme.desc: On April 10, 1995 in Aurora, Colorado, 15-year-old Curtis was one of four teens involved in the death of Christopher as they attempted to steal his car.

programme.title: Kids Behind Bars: Life or Parole
programme.desc: On March 4, 2010, 17-year-old Preston was one of three teens involved in the murder of Christopher during an attempted robbery in Fort Walton Beach, Florida.

programme.title: Kids Behind Bars: Life or Parole
programme.desc: On March 7, 1992, 15-year-old Bobby shot girlfriend Krissi's mother and father as they slept in their home in Frisco, Texas. Roz was killed, but her husband Buz survived.

programme.title: Kids Behind Bars: Life or Parole
programme.desc: On November 24, 1990, 15-year-old James killed his stepmother and three young brothers with a shotgun, and then set their rural Wyoming home on fire.

programme.title: Interrogation Cam
programme.desc: A 73-year-old murder suspect trashes the interrogation room; a married mother of three admits to a 26-year-old cold case killing; a multi-murder suspect refuses to answer questions until he can hug his wife.

programme.title: Interrogation Cam
programme.desc: A shooting suspect begins cutting himself with a pocket knife after investigators leave him alone in the interrogation room; a woman breaks down after telling police that she drowned her grandmother.

programme.title: Interrogation Cam
programme.desc: "Interrogation Cam" takes place inside the interrogation rooms of law enforcement agencies; each episode features real crime stories and spotlights the techniques used by investigators to uncover unbelievable revelations in the pursuit of justice.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Whether legends of vast, lost treasures hidden throughout the U.S. are real or tall tales.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Scientists are involved in a never-ending quest to understand the vast universe the planet inhabits; it seems that for each answer science provides, even more questions arise.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Throughout history, many have believed that certain places, things, or even people can be tainted with dark curses. Ominous lakes that morph into watery graves.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Our five senses construct the reality of the world around us. But what about when one or more of your senses is heightened, changed, or even taken away all together?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio A. Tsoukalos studies India's Sanskrit texts, which are filled with descriptions of brain surgery, flying crafts, nuclear physics, and other advanced sciences; Hindu scholars attribute this knowledge to a time when gods walked among humans.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Robots are being programmed to do everything from performing surgery on humans, to investigating other planets; humanoid robots are quickly reaching a level of sophistication that was thought to exist only in science fiction.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Could gold be the ultimate link between humans and aliens? A church in southern France is said to hold the key to alchemy.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Researchers explore the strange similarities among pyramids in Egypt, Central and South America, China, Africa, and Indonesia, including a possible extraterrestrial link connecting these structures.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: In ancient Mesopotamia, the Sumerians make advances in agriculture, science, medicine, and astronomy, crediting these achievements to winged gods known as the Anunnaki.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The myths behind reptilian aliens may provide evidence that suggests the creatures are more than just science fiction.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Treasure hunter Marty Lagina and Ancient Astronaut theorist Giorgio A. Tsoukalos explore the bizarre statues, mysterious pyramids and gigantic structures left behind by one of the most mysterious cultures in the ancient world in Sardinia, Italy.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio A. Tsoukalos studies India's Sanskrit texts, which are filled with descriptions of brain surgery, flying crafts, nuclear physics, and other advanced sciences; Hindu scholars attribute this knowledge to a time when gods walked among humans.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Robots are being programmed to do everything from performing surgery on humans, to investigating other planets; humanoid robots are quickly reaching a level of sophistication that was thought to exist only in science fiction.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Could gold be the ultimate link between humans and aliens? A church in southern France is said to hold the key to alchemy.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Researchers explore the strange similarities among pyramids in Egypt, Central and South America, China, Africa, and Indonesia, including a possible extraterrestrial link connecting these structures.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: In ancient Mesopotamia, the Sumerians make advances in agriculture, science, medicine, and astronomy, crediting these achievements to winged gods known as the Anunnaki.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The myths behind reptilian aliens may provide evidence that suggests the creatures are more than just science fiction.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: A cryptic journal sparks an unprecedented investigation into whether a UFO crashed at Roswell, N.M., in 1947; Major Jesse Marcel's journal may contain coded clues to the truth behind Roswell.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: A former CIA operative's investigation into the Roswell crash arrives at a critical moment when the mysterious journal found among the possessions of Maj. Jesse Marcel undergoes a crucial test.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: Investigator Ben Smith travels to Jesse Marcel's hometown on Louisiana's Gulf Coast to speak with family members who reveal information that supports Marcel's story of a government coverup.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The U.S. military denies that the 1947 Roswell crash involved anything other than a weather balloon, but theorists claim that other UFO crashes were reported all over the world at the same time as the crash and that the wreckages were retrieved.

programme.title: My Uncle Is the Green River Killer

programme.title: Evil Up Close
programme.desc: A chef thinks he has hit the jackpot when he finds love with the waitress he had been pursuing, but he soon realizes he is just wrapped up in her deadly plan.

programme.title: Evil Up Close
programme.desc: Elizabeth Olten, nine, lived near Bustamante; Bustamante convinced her younger sister to bring Olten to the forest by their homes to play.

programme.title: Evil Up Close
programme.desc: Reign of terror by a caring husband by day, serail rapist by night.

programme.title: Dead Again
programme.desc: A 1996 murder and possible sexual assault of a 19-year-old woman tears apart a small town in Southern Texas; Michele, Joe and Kevin discover new evidence 16 years later that may prove the real killer is not the one on death row.

programme.title: Dead Again
programme.desc: The case of a doctor who was gunned down in a suspected carjacking takes a turn when the detectives take a deeper look into the victim's personal life.

programme.title: Dead Again

programme.title: The Timeline
programme.desc: The story behind the controversial play call that secured a playoff victory for the Patriots in a season that ended with a New England Super Bowl win.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The first World Series to be played in an indoor ballpark, the Twins used their familiarity with the Metrodome to their advantage to capture their first World Series Championship since moving to Minnesota.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: Energized by an unthinkable pinch-hit walk-off homer from Kirk Gibson, the Los Angeles Dodgers rally to upset the Oakland Athletics in five games to win the 1988 World Series.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1991 matchup between the Twins and the Braves. Both teams went from worst to first before battling it out in a close series that showcased five games decided by one run and the Twins securing the World Series title.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: On April 3, 2018 in his first-ever at-bat at Angel Stadium, Japanese phenom Shohei Ohtani crushes a three-run home run, earning himself a curtain call from the Los Angeles crowd.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: On the day of Thurman Munson's funeral, eulogist Bobby Murcer leads the Yankees to a walk-off win.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Just 10 days after the tragic September 11 attacks, Mike Piazza lifts a dramatic go-ahead home run in the 8th inning to lift the Mets and the city of New York in the first baseball game played in the city after the tragedy.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: On September 26, 2016, the Marlins overcame the tragic loss of pitcher José Fernández to secure an emotional victory, rallying together to honor his memory and celebrate his life amidst profound grief and sorrow.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Roy Halladay outpitches Mark Buehrle in a duel on the mound in the Blue Jays' 2-0 win.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Tony Pérez leads the Reds to clinch World Series over Boston

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Ichiro Suzuki plays in his final Major League game, announcing his retirement after the Mariners conclude a two-game series with the Athletics at the Tokyo Dome in Japan.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Kevin Gausman sets a new career-high with 13 strikeouts across seven frames against the Mariners.

programme.title: Cathedrals of the Game
programme.desc: Host Michelle Beadle tours PETCO Park, built in the heart of downtown San Diego and explores the area's storied baseball history.

programme.title: Cathedrals of the Game
programme.desc: Take an exclusive tour of Rogers Centre in Downtown Toronto, Canada. The stadium opened in 1989 and was the first sports venue with a fully retractable roof.

programme.title: Epic Innings
programme.desc: "George Brett and the 'sticky' bat, Steve Garvey saving the Padres' season, and more.

programme.title: Epic Moments
programme.desc: Reliving Madison Bumgarner's outstanding postseason run in 2014 as he pitched the San Francisco Giants to their third World Series victory in five seasons.

programme.title: MLB's Carded
programme.desc: MLB's Carded heads to The National Sports Collectors Convention and sits down with Bobby Witt Jr

programme.title: All-Star Highlights
programme.desc: MLB stars from the AL and NL face off in San Diego in the 1992 All-Star Game.

programme.title: MLB Network Presents
programme.desc: MLB Network looks back at the career of "The Hit Man" in Donnie Baseball, the latest installment of the MLB Network Presents series

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Francisco Lindor and Jay Bruce lead Cleveland to their 22nd consecutive win

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Future Hall of Famer Joe Mauer hits his first career walk-off homer to give the Twins a 4-3 win.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Max Scherzer throws a near close perfect game no-hitter against the Pirates

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: The Phillies bring home the franchise's first ever World Series Championship

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: At the 2000 All-Star Game, Derek Jeter and Chipper Jones both go 3-for-3. The American League scores three insurance runs in the top of the 9th inning to secure their 6-3 victory over the National League.

programme.desc: The guys see how wet and dry nitrous systems stack up on an EFI manifold.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: Multipoint EFI gets its turn against the venerable Dominator.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: A supercharged medium-sized mill takes on a naturally aspirated big block.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The crew pits a four-barrel carb against dual quads on the tunnel ram.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: The guys test cars that are worlds apart in every way except horsepower.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: The 2019 McLaren 600LT faces off against the 2019 Porsche GT3 RS.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: Jethro and Jonny pit BMW's mighty M2 against the ultralight Alpine A110.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: Jonny and Jethro look at two of the last true hardcore production SUVs.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: The Alfa Romeo Giulia Quadrifoglio is up against the Jaguar Project 8.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: The MAT New Stratos and Superformance GT40 have one foot in the past.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: Jonny and Jethro live out their touring fantasies in two British beasts.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: The guys pit the legendary Shelby GT350 against the new Toyota Supra.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: The 2019 Honda Civic Type R does battle with the 2020 Hyundai Veloster N.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: The '19 Camaro ZL1 1LE goes up against the 2020 Lotus Evora.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: Jonny and Jethro drive the BMW M5 Competition and the Mercedes-AMG GT 63 S.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: Hypercars are still insane, but the idea of a supercar doesn't mean what it used to; a supercar is quiet, has room for family and friends, and delivers spine-crunching acceleration, plus exceptional range and even a luxurious driving experience.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: Jeff and Jonny can't decide which supertruck is best, or even what the definition of supertruck is; they debate whether it's about how it looks, sounds or drives, horsepower/torque, whether it can be electric, and whether it can even do truck things.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: No EV maker has yet cracked the market for hot hatches; they're small, nimble, fun - all things EVs aren't; the guys turn to gasoline to figure out the best hot hatch on the market today: the Toyota GR Corolla or the Honda Civic Type R.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: Exploring whether BMW maintains the title of undisputed fast sedan king.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: Pitting the Rivian R1S against the Lamborghini Urus to find out which is best.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: MotorTrend's favorite talent competes in some fun holiday-spirit racing.

programme.title: Legendary Locations
programme.desc: Josh explores a millionaire's disappearance and an ancient city's collapse.

programme.title: Legendary Locations
programme.desc: Josh explores a millionaire's disappearance and an ancient city's collapse.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: The guys drive Audi's S1 Hoonitron, a car that's next level in all aspects.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The Martins face the challenge of trying to fit a 6'5" former football player into the cab of a 1967 Chevy C10, requiring customization of the firewall, motor, frame and interior.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Facing deadline, the shop struggles to fit a gigantic ex-NFL player into a tiny 1967 Chevy C10 that includes a customized leather interior and automated bed cover.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe is pushing his engineering chops to the limit by building a monster trike that would look right at home on the set of a "Mad Max" movie.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Shag and Amanda get a '65 Chevy II Nova for a steal, but as the team digs in, rat nests and rust are the least of their worries; the build requires a complete overhaul and has them thinking they bit off more than they can chew.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Fitment issues in the engine bay leave the entire shop scratching their heads; Joe has big plans for the '65 Nova, but a small space to work with.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A customer wants to surprise his wife with major upgrades to her '68 Corvette convertible, but working with the fiberglass body soon brings on headaches that threaten both the car and the shop to crack under the pressure.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The clock is ticking to complete a 1968 Corvette convertible, but messy fiberglass repairs uncover major collision damage; and if that wasn't enough, the customer also wants an all-white interior, which isn't a good fit for such a dirty job.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A time capsule rolls into the shop in the form of a 1983 Silverado with exactly 69.2 miles on it; the owner recently passed away, and his daughter wants to finish turning his truck into a modern muscle car under the hood.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Amanda and Shag stumble upon a '73 Vega with a rich history and a seller anxious to see his car restored to glory; they plan to chop the top and add a enormous engine, but first they must tackle over 40 years of rust and grime.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin brings new life to old iron at his shop Joe Martin Customs; working with his wife Amanda, and best friend Shag, this custom shop oversees every phase of restoration from design, fabrication and mechanicals, to the final paint job.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A '57 Chevy looks great, but the guys discover that looks can be deceiving.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin puts the finishing touches on the 1957 Chevrolet Bel Air and arranges for the car to be delivered to the owner; Joe uses all his tricks to prepare a Chevrolet C10 for a charity auction with a stylish paint job.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe and the team finish up the '51 Chevy 3100 Christmas-parade truck.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe and the team finish up the '51 Chevy 3100 Christmas-parade truck.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe dusts off his prized '65 Pontiac Catalina to give it the facelift it deserves -- new brakes, new trick frame and a bigger, badder LSA 600 horsepower motor. Meanwhile, Martin Bros. Customs tricks out the interior on an iconic 1932 Ford Roadster.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: With updates well underway on custom car guru Joe Martin's prized '65 Pontiac Catalina, Joe and the boys at Martin Bros. Customs give the ol' choppy-doo to a '41 DeSoto that has seen better days.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A longtime customer has his eye set on a car from Joe's personal collection, a 1967 Nova; Joe counters by offering up a 1966 Nova, with the guarantee that it will be twice the car Joe's is; big brakes, big power, big wheels and more.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe pulls out all the stops to make the '66 Nova the car of his client's dreams; Joe doesn't just want a mean motor and big tires; he wants a chopped roof, but the car might be too far behind schedule for a chop, even if it does up the cool factor.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A customer from New York entrusts Joe with his prized 1965 Buick Riviera.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe and the crew button up the 1965 Riviera's wiring, interior and paint.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.title: Imprisoned by Love
programme.desc: Below the surface of her perfect life, Tracie weathers constant marital abuse for the sake of her children. What will it cost to save herself?

programme.title: Unexceptional Love
programme.desc: The faith of a deeply religious couple is put to the ultimate test after complications during pregnancy result in the premature birth of their child.

programme.title: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: College freshman Stacy falls for a charming grad student named Benjamin. But when he begins to physically abuse her, she looks for a way out.

programme.title: Reindeer Games
programme.desc: A man encounters an unexpected curveball during the holiday season and must learn the true value of falling and staying in love.

programme.title: A True Christmas
programme.desc: Reminded of her past, Jessica can't stand Christmas, but this holiday season has several surprises in store that will help her create new memories.

programme.title: For the Love of Christmas
programme.desc: Rashad Williams faces down the pressures of making a dramatic career choice and getting married to Lauren—and all before Christmas Day.

programme.title: Single Bells
programme.desc: When the Bell sisters lose their family restaurant during Christmas, they hatch a plan to save it—and unexpectedly find romance along the way.

programme.title: A Very Merry New Year
programme.desc: A Fortune 500 CEO decides to gather her best high school friends for a New Year's Eve reunion celebration that winds up exposing long-hidden secrets.

programme.title: Endless Summer
programme.desc: A man who has been dreaming of the love of his life has one last day to be noticed by her, but his obnoxious family and her boyfriend get in the way.

programme.desc: This last year has been unlike any other: COVID, lockdowns, and for Gary, it has also included a divorce and family insanity unlike any other; up until now, Gary hasn't been able to speak about what really happened.

programme.title: Anjelah Johnson: The Homecoming Show
programme.desc: The comic shares her stories of growing up with a sports enthusiast father who never wanted to pay for athletic training, and other hilarious tales.

programme.title: Kathleen Madigan: Madigan Again
programme.desc: Her Irish Catholic Midwest family, pills in her mom’s purse, touring Afghanistan, an unparalleled love of John Denver…are all fodder for this special.

programme.title: Iliza Shlesinger: War Paint
programme.desc: Iliza Shlesinger performs her first stand-up special in her hometown of Dallas, Texas.

programme.title: Iliza Shlesinger: Freezing Hot
programme.desc: The acclaimed Last Comic Standing winner explains how women hate being cold, but love cold weather, and other hilarious observations.

programme.title: Eddie Griffin: Undeniable
programme.desc: Eddie Griffin brings his blunt and undeniable style to this stand-up set about athletes and racial stereotypes, relationships, and human mistakes.

programme.title: Eddie Griffin: You Can Tell 'Em I Said It
programme.desc: The excitable comic again proves why he is one of the world’s premiere funnymen, ripping into racial stereotypes, Viagra, the First Lady, and more.

programme.title: Arnez J.: Racially Motivated
programme.desc: Tackling everything from race relations to family life to hilarious impersonations, Arnez J is laugh-out-loud funny in his one-hour special.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Nigel and Pok U Regan cultivate an east-meets-west atmosphere at their B&B and Cantonese restaurant, the Bingham Townhouse in Nottinghamshire.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Float by Boat, near Rugby, partners Kev Argent and Tor Johnson run mediation and mindfulness breaks from their narrowboat, Spirited Away.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Filey, North Yorkshire, at The White Lodge Hotel, where hosts James and Kim Hodgson hope their love of luxury and high standards will win over their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Crystals on The Prom in Blackpool, where Amanda Lucia-Charley, joined by friend Alan Talbot, hopes her unique and theatrical design decisions will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week's third visit is to The Red Lion Country Inn in Upper Poppleton, North Yorkshire, where practical pair Mark and Jean Lee hope their plain and simple pub B&B will impress their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Finishing off the competition is glamping site Camp Katur in Kirklington, where Kerry Roy and Nicola Wilding hope to wow the guests with their unique `geodomes' and see through pods.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at The Farmyard Inn in Youlgrave, in the Peak District, where manager Susan Day is joined by her best friend Andrea Scott.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Stoneleigh B&B in Trowbridge, where ex-teachers Meg and Andy Slade invite the guests into their family home.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit, the competition heads to Whittlesey, Peterborough, and The Falcon Hotel, where Colin and Michelle Wilson hope their no frills pub will impress.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Finishing off the competition is Grimscote Manor Hotel in Birmingham, owned by business partners Steve Cuddy and Gill Etheridge, who aim to bring elegant sophistication to the hospitality trade.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at The Cholmeley Arms in Burton-le-Coggles, Lincolnshire, run by chef John Berry and his wife Lesley.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Islington Mill B&B in Salford, where Joe Spencer and Louise Woodcock have an alternative hosting style as their drag alter egos: Joyce De Vision and Trish Dee.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit this week is to Pebbles B&B in Seaton, Devon, where host Peter Morris opened his family home to guests eight months ago.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to the Tarr Farm Inn on Exmoor, where Hilary Lester rules the roost with assistant manager Stacey Wade.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit is to the Bridge Hotel in Scunthorpe with new owners Martin and Hannah Weaver. On arrival, Rob and Michelle Earp from Seashells B&B in Sutton-on-Sea find a condom by the entrance, and Clare Davies and Fran Hancock from The New Court Hotel in Usk have concerns over interior cleanliness. Tom Jones and Samara Cohen from The Crown at Whitchurch judge the rooms to be little more than functional.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The group stay at Sue's dog friendly Seashells Guesthouse in Great Yarmouth no one knows quite what to expect.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to East Linton in Scotland and the Crown and Kitchen.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The New Court Hotel in Usk, where manager Clare Davies is joined in the competition by the pub owner's mother, Fran Hancock. On arrival, Tom and Samara are impressed, but Martin and Hannah find lots of cleanliness issues. At dinner, there are tensions as the group discuss who would take which role if they were to run a B&B together. Breakfast is cooked by Clare, but peppery eggs and missing mushrooms cause concern.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at The Admiral Hotel in central London, run by owner So Shaw and hotel manager Kevin Jankunas.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to The Redstone in Blackpool, where high-end hotelier Ursula Beswick and manager Daria Pakalnicka hope their luxury guest house will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition continues at Ann's Farmhouse in Thornton, Yorkshire, owned by Chris Foster, who's assisted by his good friend, Christel Richter.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The R Inn in Desborough, owned by Kris Malde, who's helped out by events manager Vikki Cheetham.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Stockton Mill B&B in Shropshire, where Stephen and Caroline Cox hope to provide a home from home for their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Duxford Lodge in Cambridgeshire, run by ex-phone salesman Kevin Patel. He's hoping to turn his family-owned hotel into a 1940s inspired B&B.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to The Riverside House Hotel in Mildenhall, where experienced hoteliers Ged Sharrocks and Suzanne Law offer a full hotel experience helped by their staff.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Last to host are Stacey Walsham and Gemma Dyche from The Gate Hangs High in Hook Norton, Oxfordshire, where they hope their dog-friendly accommodation will go down a treat.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Hampshire, at The Poacher Inn, where manager Nadia Schicci hopes her Italian directness and business approach will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Forest Country House in Powys, Wales, where owner Paul Martin, joined by best friend and neighbour, Jayne Kirk, hopes his luxury BandB will impress his guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit the group head to Fenwick, Scotland and Langside Bed and Breakfast, where high rolling, super clean hosts Debbie and Jim hope their business will wow the crowd.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to the historic The Tushielaw Inn in Selkirk, Scotland, opened by Rab and Gail Forbes six months ago. Gail and Rab try to build bridges, but things take a downward turn.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Rooms 36 in The Lake District, owned by health-conscious Andy Peters, who is joined by friend and fellow B&B owner, Jeronime Palmer.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second hosts of the week are mother and son team Trish and Connor Richardson from the Red Lion Coaching Inn near Gainsborough.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Schiehallion Hotel in Aberfeldy, run by Julie Dunbar and James Graham. Some guests are impressed, but luxury lovers Andy and Jeronime are left wanting more.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to Townhead Hotel in Lockerbie, owned by Stephen Montgomery and partner Jan. On arrival, the high level of finish in the rooms is a surprise for all of the guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: In Stratford upon Avon at The Water's Edge Guest House, owner Julie Allison and friend Gerry Crabtree hope their luxurious approach and themed rooms will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the Kilpeck Inn in Herefordshire where head chef Ross Williams and front of house manager Kath Capel consider no detail too small.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third stop is The Fox Inn in Guisborough where young hosts Michael Crane and Jai Bennison are determined to impress their guests with their straight-forward northern B&B.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Ivanhoe Guest House, Bridlington, Mick and Gill Jennings think their simple approach will win the day. But at breakfast some serious allegations are made about the food.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Falmouth in Cornwall, where Gaye Woods, owner of Meudon Hotel, hopes her family run hotel will win the day, but are her room rates too high?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Malborough in Devon and The Royal Oak pub, run by Tim Heap with help from his barman Mikey Martindale. Following some unwanted extras at breakfast, feedback is tough.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is in Tiverton in Devon and The Angel Guest House where owners Chris and Sue Holliday have created a homespun experience, but will they prove too competitive for the guests?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth visit is The Compton Swan in Newbury, owned by Geoff Jones and Joan McGowan. Expectations are high after Joan reveals she was named Ireland's Business Woman of the Year.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Brighton Surf Hotel, Jeremy Mann and his Russian wife Elena hope their hands-off hosting style will win the day, despite the lack of breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Number 16, in Greenwich, London. Owner Robert Gray, an actor and antiques dealer, charms with his hosting, but Jan and Les find the dusty decor off-putting.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Fleur de Lis in Sandwich in Kent, hosts Jan and Les Fisher are convinced that their traditional place will impress their guests, but Robert is bent on revenge.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to The Barn at Dale End House near Matlock in the Peak District, owned by Sarah Summers. Sarah is dreading Robert's arrival, but all the guests are bowled over.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Starting in Betws-y-coed, North Wales, where at Llwyn Onn Guest House, bikers Wayne and Tracy Dunn hope their no-nonsense attitude will win the competition.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Parkwood Hotel in Stockton on Tees, where newlywed managers Jon and Chelli Bean are all about making things perfect for pooches.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to Great Glen in Leicestershire and The Pug and Greyhound, where Nicola Ellershaw and her colleague, Mackenzie Griffey, hope their super-stylish accommodation will dazzle.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Solar Strand Hotel in Crosskeys, Wales, where former IT consultant Gary Pesticcio and his daughter, Naomi, hope their high-tech B&B will power them to victory.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at The Shoes, Durham, where landlord Billy Gowland and partner Debbie Nelson hope their footwear-themed pub BandB is the right fit for their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Biggin Hall Hotel in Derbyshire, where owner James Moffat and partner Annie Larner hope the BandBers will fall for the rural charm of their 17th-century farmhouse.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit the group head to yurt glamp-site, Forest Garden Shovelstrode in East Sussex, where hosts Charles and Lisa Hooper hope the BandBers buy into their woodland retreat.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Derby Manor Hotel and Restaurant run by mother and son team Fiona and James Milligan who opened their doors eight months ago after a million pound refurbishment.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Hope Mountain in North Wales, where husband and wife team, Rob and Jo Smith hope their dog-friendly B&B will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Beaumont Hotel in Louth, near Lincoln, where managers and best friends, Steffi Stevenson and Sarah Banks, pride themselves on being the `queens of clean'.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Rock House Hotel in Lynmouth, Devon, where owner Emilio Tundidor is assisted by his identical twin brother Fernando.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Troy House in Painswick, where owners Alan and Denise Newman hope their guests will fall in love with their rooms.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Flying the flag on day two are Norfolk couple Jenny and Richard Harmer, from Chimneys B&B in North Walsham.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Copperfields Guest House in Broadstairs, Kent, where owners Neale and Julie Taylor hope their exclusively vegetarian B&B will stand out from the crowd.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week the group head to The George and Abbotsford in Melrose, Scotland, where host Andrea Gardner and front of house manager John Marr pull out all the stops.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Massimo's in Seaham, County Durham, where Italian chef Massimo Perrulli is joined by his cousin, Raf, on front of house. Emotions run riot as things come to a head.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This competition kicks off in Malvern, Worcestershire where retired pro-rugby player Steve Lloyd and partner Kathy Leather open their Copper Beech House to fellow B&B owners.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the pet friendly Dog in a Doublet pub and restaurant in Peterborough where Della McGinn's passion for animals comes a close second to husband John's passion for food.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week, the B&Bers head to the Torcroft Boutique B&B in Torquay, Devon, where Europhiles Phil and Sharon Hobson hope their added extras will win over their rivals.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to the 600-year-old Rhydspence Inn in Herefordshire, owned by Mark and Lowrie Price. All guests are charmed by the medieval inn, but there's still underlying tension.

programme.desc: The final visit is to Delamere Farm in Northborough, where owner Agi Chapman, who is joined by Jayne Thorpe Godman, prides herself on providing a luxurious sleep to all her visitors.

programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to New Promenade Hotel in Blackpool, owned by Raouf, who is joined by friend Chrissie. There's a teetering toilet seat and Clarky and Katie find muck on the taps.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to Vicky's small terraced house, aptly named The Terrace, in Oxford. On inspection, two pairs of guests discover an array of filthy finds, including a pre-sucked sweet.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Robin and Liza's Georgian mansion Tall John's House in the Brecon Beacons. At dinner the guests gush over their new friendships but Vicky doesn't share their feelings.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit sees Sam and Henry confident that their five-star rooms above a quintessential English country pub, The Bear and Swan, in Chew Magna, Somerset, will impress their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Will Ali the penguin keeper slip and slide his way to success on the Qualifier?

programme.title: 101 Ways to Leave a Gameshow
programme.desc: Steve Jones hosts the series where contestants are ejected in the most nerve-wracking means ever seen on TV.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Mesmerized by Bon Bon’s Belly Dancing, we catch up with our favourite Big Balls in the Qualifier. They dish out punishment to Australia’s very own female Jim Carrey and send Big Cat tamer Robbie into the pond. Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. Golden Guns, Marisa battles it out for the ladies against Perfect Specimen, Seamus in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: 101 Ways to Leave a Gameshow
programme.desc: More unsuspecting contestants, all competing for a 10k pound prize, are dropped, fired and dragged screaming.

programme.title: 101 Ways to Leave a Gameshow
programme.desc: Steve Jones hosts the series where contestants are ejected in the craziest ways possible.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring World’s Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: During this episode contestants face new challenges on 'The Qualifier'.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, contestants face different games like The Qualifier, The Crash Mountain and Dizzy Dummies.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Tonight, twenty brave battlers will take on the wintry weirdness.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose “Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk” training comes into play.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the second 'Celebrity Special' of the season. This time, all of them face 'The Qualifier'.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: The Qualifier sees the return of an old favourite, the ‘Big Red Balls’.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. This week we are forced to take notice of Demolition Dave, a 49 yr old South Australia man who thanks to some home training smashes the qualifier. For those lucky enough to survive the Fly Screen Sweeper it was Dizzy Dummy time. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, twenty intrepid contestants take on four gruelling obstacles.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Winter Wipeout has the awards show to end all awards shows –The Snow Globes.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Donut run, ball swing. Sweeper: Dangly balls. Dizzy Dummy: barrel crossing and log roll

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, twenty intrepid contestants take on four gruelling obstacles.

programme.title: 101 Ways to Leave a Gameshow
programme.desc: Steve Jones hosts the series where contestants are ejected in the most nerve-wracking means ever seen on TV.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: The Winter Blob makes a welcome appearance to send the contestants into orbit whilst Granny’s House.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: 101 Ways to Leave a Gameshow
programme.desc: More unsuspecting contestants, all competing for a 10k pound prize, are dropped, fired and dragged screaming.

programme.title: 101 Ways to Leave a Gameshow

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Today’s courageous band of volunteers include a former world class athlete intent on making a comeback.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard and co-host Amanda return with new obstacles, new contestants and LOTS of falling in this episode.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the last episode of the season and the 8 previous winners compete to be the Champion of Champions.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, the North of the country takes on the South in a battle to win the coveted trophy.

programme.desc: Returning contender Alan Murchison and newcomers Colin Buchan and Mark Greenaway must cook their fish course, but which one will prevail? programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Scottish chefs - returning contender Alan Murchison and newcomers Colin Buchan and Mark Greenaway. All of them are determined to knock out their rivals in the race to the banquet. This is the final chance to impress `Great British Menu' veteran Jeremy Lee with their dessert dishes - `Going for Gold', modern day Eton mess, and beetroot cake with chocolate mousse and fennel ice cream.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is decision time for the chefs from Scotland. The two remaining chefs cook their entire menus for the `Great British Menu' judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges aren't easily pleased and only world class cooking will do. Only one chef can make it through to the national finals to represent Scotland. If they win, one of their dishes could be on the menu at The Olympic Feast.

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs Aktar Islam, Daniel Clifford and Paul Foster cook their fish course, but which one will prevail? programme.desc: South West contenders Paul Ainsworth and Nathan Outlaw, plus newcomer Simon Hulstone, kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs cook their fish course, but which one but which one will prevail? Will it be Paul Ainsworth with monkfish `Two Showings'; Nathan Outlaw with mackerel, horseradish and oyster sauce; or Simon Hulstone with `The Swimming Pool'?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With a refined summer barbecue going up against a traditional Cornish speciality and a historic Wimbledon related recipe, who will come out on top? Andy Clatworthy is using his passion for historical cooking to reinvent a dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the chefs' final chance to impress the veteran with their dessert dishes. Will it be Paul Ainsworth with `Then and Now'; Nathan Outlaw with elderflower and lemon tart, with strawberry sorbet and meringues; or Simon Hulstone with `Closing Ceremony'?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's decision time on Great British Menu for the chefs from the South West region. programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The 2012 competition enters its final week. The winners of the regional heats compete for a chance for their dish to be on the final banquet menu at a prestigious event hosted by Sir Steve Redgrave with a glittering guest list of British Olympians. Here, the finalists cook their starters, which will be tasted and scored by the `Great British Menu' judges and veteran judge Richard Corrigan.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The eight winners of the regional heats prepare to cook their fish dishes, which will be tasted and scored by the `Great British Menu' judges and veteran judge Marcus Wareing. Before they get into the kitchen, they must first learn whether they will all be cooking.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: On day three, the chosen finalists cook their main courses, which will be tasted and scored by the `Great British Menu' judges and veteran judge Tom Kerridge.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's desserts day in the finals, and the last chance for the competing chefs to impress the judges and veteran Angela Hartnett. programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This final programme follows the successful chefs in the run-up to the Olympic banquet at the Old Royal Naval College in Greenwich, as they make the painstaking preparations for what is one of the most important meals they will ever cook. The four winning chefs prepare an outstanding four-course menu for a truly Olympian guest list.

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As plants begin to show their early growth, Monty gets plenty of plants for free when he demonstrates how to make the most of herbaceous perennials. He also cuts back pelargoniums that have overwintered in the greenhouse and makes a start on sowing vegetables. Nick Bailey shares plans for his new garden in Northamptonshire and shows how to create a container garden ideal for those on the move. Frances Tophill discovers more ways to use cut flowers as she visits a florist in Devon.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Accompany Mark Peterson on his ongoing expedition through California, where he pursues the elusive Tule Elk. Notably, the elk inhabiting this region underwent reclassification from Roosevelt to Tule elk in 2023. Recalling his previous hunt in 2019 with his rifle, Mark is now equipped with his Gunwerks Muzzleloader and he endeavors to achieve optimal proximity for a successful encounter.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his quest on the Hearst Ranch in California. Next up on the list, California Aoudad. These Aoudad were introduced to the ranch in the early 1920s and have thrived ever since.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: WE join Bobby Falkenberg as he joins Bret Ferguson from Double T Outfitters. Bobby is an avid outdoorsman, judge, and father of 5. Bret manages 30,000 acres in Ozona TX, the knowledge he has of every inch of this amazing low fence ranch is remarkable. Bobby has an action packed 2 day hunt.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every spring brings a new opportunity to take a step forward & recall the memories of seasons past. World War II Veteran and retired Judge Arden Hill has spent most of his life chasing turkeys in the hills of Tennessee. Now in his 90’s, Arden doesn’t let age stand in the way of his love for spring turkey hunting. Also: patterning turkey shotguns and hunting spring gobblers.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation

programme.title: TRP
